definition: to turn round/to turn one's head/later/by and by
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
repeat customer
to turn back/to backtrack/(fig.) to revert to the former way of doing things

lit. once you've shot the arrow, there's no getting it back (idiom)/fig. once you started sth, there's no turning back/to have to finish what one started/to be determined to reach one's goals in spite of setbacks
pinyin: kai1 gong1 mei2 you3 hui2 tou2 jian4

definition: the return of a prodigal son (idiom)
the road back to where one came from
a prodigal son returned home is worth more than gold
pinyin: lang4 zi3 hui2 tou2 jin1 bu4 huan4

definition: lit. a good horse doesn't turn around and graze the same patch again (idiom)/fig. once you've moved on, don't go back again (romantic relationship, job etc)/leave the past behind
pinyin: hao3 ma3 bu4 chi1 hui2 tou2 cao3

definition: See you!/Bye!
to stubbornly insist on one's own ideas (idiom)
pinyin: bu4 zhuang4 nan2 qiang2 bu4 hui2 tou2

definition: return of the prodigal son
The sea of bitterness has no bounds, turn your head to see the shore (idiom). Only Buddhist enlightenment can allow one to shed off the abyss of worldly suffering./Repent and ye shall be saved!
pinyin: ku3 hai3 wu2 bian1 , hui2 tou2 shi4 an4

sentences.english: Bull Market Correcting or Bear Returning?
sentences.chinese: 此際是牛市調整或是熊市回頭？

sentences.english: In retrospect, I’d say that Huntington committed the Fundamental Attribution Error.
sentences.chinese: 回頭來看，我認爲亨廷頓犯了“基本的歸因錯誤”。
回頭他就表演套名人模仿秀。

sentences.english: When SSH jokes, he will turn hellos head and look for KTHsreaction.
sentences.chinese: 宋承憲講嘲笑話的時候回頭不雅察泰熙反映。

sentences.english: Frequently, natural go back not the most direct way.
sentences.chinese: 頻頻回頭的人，自然走不了遠路。

sentences.english: I walk slowly, but I never walk back.
sentences.chinese: 也許走得慢點兒，可我絕不會走回頭路。

sentences.english: We would lose a lot of time if we backtracked.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們倒回頭往原路開的話，會損失許多時間。

sentences.english: I made the call finally, and she thanked me gratefully and wanted to return home.
sentences.chinese: 我把電話打通了，她感激地謝了我，回頭就走。

sentences.english: But I am less interested in looking backward than I am in looking forwards.
sentences.chinese: 但是我對回頭看沒有興趣，我要朝前看。

sentences.english: Hamilton said he lost time in T9 (where Webber crashed) and on the final hairpin he lost whatever advantage he had.
sentences.chinese: 漢密爾頓說在9號彎角和最後一個回頭彎沒有跑好。

sentences.english: When SSH jokes, he will turn his head and look for KTHsreaction.
sentences.chinese: 宋承憲講冷笑話的時間回頭視察泰熙反映。

sentences.english: I noticed that he kept looking over at me. He had been doing a lot of that.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到他不斷回頭朝我這邊看，事實上他常這麼幹。

sentences.english: Don't look back, and don't stop anywhere in the plain!
sentences.chinese: 不可回頭看，也不可在平原站住。

sentences.english: Mr Bloom looked back towards the choir.
sentences.chinese: 布盧姆先生回頭望了望唱詩班。

sentences.english: As the donkey passed by, I looked back unknowingly.
sentences.chinese: 驢兒過去了，無意中回頭一看。

sentences.english: I am a slow walker, but I never walk back.
sentences.chinese: 我走的不快，但絕不走回頭路。

definition: (of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
(in the) past/former/previous/to go over/to pass by
(verb suffix)
to raise one's head/to gain ground/account name, or space for writing the name on checks, bills etc
to bow the head/to yield/to give in
at that time/originally
to leave/to exit
at once/immediately/promptly/swiftly
to renounce/to abandon/to give up
to depart/to leave
the next one
(final particle, same as 吧)
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
to separate/to part
to walk past/to pass by
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
